Posts.Content:
I am 60. 
I have health insurance with $5,000 deductible - living off my savings. 
Had mammogram, then ultrasound, found .6 x .3 x .6cm - now they want to do fine needle aspiration. 
Told me it was thick fluid and if fine needle doesn't work then Core Aspiration. 
I can't talk to my doctor - long story - not a good doctor. 
They told me just the fine needle aspiration alone is $4,600 (not counting Core aspiration, doctors, etc). 
My question - do I really need to have an aspiration with it being so small? 
Can I wait until next mammogram (9 months) to see if any change? 
Thank you for any assistance.
Posts.Title: Do I really need breast aspiration if cyst is small?
